verses.verse: And David<WH1732> said<WH559> in his heart<WH3820>, I shall now perish<WH5595> one<WH259> day<WH3117> by the hand<WH3027> of Saul<WH7586>: there is nothing better<WH2896> for me than that<WH3588> I should speedily<WH4422> escape<WH4422> into the land<WH776> of the Philistines<WH6430>; and Saul<WH7586> shall despair<WH2976> of me, to seek<WH1245> me any more in any coast<WH1366> of Israel<WH3478>: so shall I escape<WH4422> out of his hand<WH3027>. perish: Heb. be consumed

And David<WH1732> arose<WH6965>, and he passed over<WH5674> with the six<WH8337> hundred<WH3967> men<WH376> that were with him unto Achish<WH397>, the son<WH1121> of Maoch<WH4582>, king<WH4428> of Gath<WH1661>.

And David<WH1732> dwelt<WH3427> with Achish<WH397> at Gath<WH1661>, he and his men<WH582>, every man<WH376> with his household<WH1004>, even David<WH1732> with his two<WH8147> wives<WH802>, Ahinoam<WH293> the Jezreelitess<WH3159>, and Abigail<WH26> the Carmelitess<WH3762>, Nabal's<WH5037> wife<WH802>.
And it was told<WH5046> Saul<WH7586> that David<WH1732> was fled<WH1272> to Gath<WH1661>: and he sought<WH1245> no more again<WH3254> <WH3254> for him.

And David<WH1732> said<WH559> unto Achish<WH397>, If I have now found<WH4672> grace<WH2580> in thine eyes<WH5869>, let them give<WH5414> me a place<WH4725> in some<WH259> town<WH5892> in the country<WH7704>, that I may dwell<WH3427> there: for why should thy servant<WH5650> dwell<WH3427> in the royal<WH4467> city<WH5892> with thee?
Then Achish<WH397> gave<WH5414> him Ziklag<WH6860> that day<WH3117>: wherefore Ziklag<WH6860> pertaineth unto the kings<WH4428> of Judah<WH3063> unto this day<WH3117>.

And the time<WH4557> <WH3117> that David<WH1732> dwelt<WH3427> in the country<WH7704> of the Philistines<WH6430> was a full year<WH3117> and four<WH702> months<WH2320>. the time: Heb. the number of days a full year: Heb. a year of days

And David<WH1732> and his men<WH582> went up<WH5927>, and invaded<WH6584> the Geshurites<WH1651>, and the Gezrites<WH1511>, and the Amalekites<WH6003>: for those<WH2007> nations were of old<WH5769> the inhabitants<WH3427> of the land<WH776>, as thou goest<WH935> to Shur<WH7793>, even unto the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>. Gezrites: or, Gerzites

And David<WH1732> smote<WH5221> the land<WH776>, and left neither man<WH376> nor woman<WH802> alive<WH2421>, and took away<WH3947> the sheep<WH6629>, and the oxen<WH1241>, and the asses<WH2543>, and the camels<WH1581>, and the apparel<WH899>, and returned<WH7725>, and came<WH935> to Achish<WH397>.

And Achish<WH397> said<WH559>, Whither<WH408> have ye made a road<WH6584> to day<WH3117>? And David<WH1732> said<WH559>, Against the south<WH5045> of Judah<WH3063>, and against the south<WH5045> of the Jerahmeelites<WH3397>, and against the south<WH5045> of the Kenites<WH7017>. Whither: or, Did you not make a road, etc

And David<WH1732> saved<WH2421> neither man<WH376> nor woman<WH802> alive<WH2421>, to bring<WH935> tidings to Gath<WH1661>, saying<WH559>, Lest they should tell<WH5046> on us, saying<WH559>, So did<WH6213> David<WH1732>, and so will be his manner<WH4941> all the while<WH3117> he dwelleth<WH3427> in the country<WH7704> of the Philistines<WH6430>.

And Achish<WH397> believed<WH539> David<WH1732>, saying<WH559>, He hath made his people<WH5971> Israel<WH3478> utterly<WH887> to abhor<WH887> him; therefore he shall be my servant<WH5650> for ever<WH5769>. utterly: Heb. to stink
